repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: nvim_parse_cmd() incorrectly splits mapping commands like into three arguments instead of preserving whitespace in the RHS.

Solution: Add special handling for mapping commands to parse them as exactly two arguments - the LHS and the RHS with all whitespace preserved.

Fix #21918

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body: This seems fragile. We should probably just explicitly check for the command indexes.

What special handling? Show an example of the string form converted to pseudocode structure:

    // "..." => { args=..., ... }
Factor this out into a function. I suspect similar logic exists elsewhere in the codebase, right?

isn't it specifically about :map commands ? 
```suggestion
    it('parses :map commands with space in RHS', function()
```

yes... I'm mainly trying to prevent it from turning out like this... because I feel like you wouldn't like it.

```C
static bool is_mapping_command(cmdidx_T cmdidx)
{
  switch (cmdidx) {
    // Map commands
    case CMD_map:
    case CMD_nmap:
    case CMD_vmap:
    case CMD_xmap:
    case CMD_smap:
    case CMD_omap:
    case CMD_imap:
    case CMD_lmap:
    case CMD_cmap:
    case CMD_tmap:
    // Noremap commands  
    case CMD_noremap:
    case CMD_nnoremap:
    case CMD_vnoremap:
    case CMD_xnoremap:
    case CMD_snoremap:
    case CMD_onoremap:
    case CMD_inoremap:
    case CMD_lnoremap:
    case CMD_cnoremap:
    case CMD_tnoremap:
    // Unmap commands
    case CMD_unmap:
    case CMD_nunmap:
    case CMD_vunmap:
    case CMD_xunmap:
    case CMD_sunmap:
    case CMD_ounmap:
    case CMD_iunmap:
    case CMD_lunmap:
    case CMD_cunmap:
    case CMD_tunmap:
    // Mapclear commands
    case CMD_mapclear:
    case CMD_nmapclear:
    case CMD_vmapclear:
    case CMD_xmapclear:
    case CMD_smapclear:
    case CMD_omapclear:
    case CMD_imapclear:
    case CMD_lmapclear:
    case CMD_cmapclear:
    case CMD_tmapclear:
      return true;
    default:
      return false;
  }
}
```
this also should be in a function. presumably this handling is needed elsewhere, otherwise how does vim handle :map commands?

do_exmap use `get_map_mode` which check first letter to detect map mode like 
```
  if (modec == 'i') {
    mode = MODE_INSERT;                                                  // :imap
```
Then you can define a function in ex_docmd.c that checks the value of `cmdnames[ea.cmdidx].cmd_func`.

afaict "mapping" is not used in any C function names. either "map" or "keymap".

```suggestion
bool is_map_cmd(cmdidx_T cmdidx)
```
This is a tricky case, nice bug fix 👍

 # include "api/command.c.generated.h"
 #endif
 
+/// Parse arguments for mapping commands, preserving whitespace in RHS

+/// @param arg_str  The argument string to parse
+/// @param arena    Arena allocator
+/// @return Array with at most 2 elements: [lhs, rhs]
+static Array parse_mapping_args(const char *arg_str, Arena *arena)

+static Array parse_mapping_args(const char *arg_str, Arena *arena)
+{
+  Array args = arena_array(arena, 2);  // Allocate for at most 2 arguments

comment_data.body: in any case, the comment isn't needed since that is the express purpose of that arg

title: fix(api): nvim_parse_cmd parses :map incorrectly
